item.title: Fleabag Review
item.description: About the fourth wall breaking Fleabag absolutely slaying I’ve seen some criticism towards the frequent use of the fourth wall breaking, especially in the first season, however I find that Fleabag makes a clear point throughout the series as to how that isn’t just some narrative device that holds comedic value and nothing more. Not only does it contributes to the whole theatrical atmosphere that permeates the work (as a matter of fact, Fleabag was initially written as a 10 minutes stand-up performance and then transcribed into a theatrical monologue), it’s also incredibly fitting and functional to address the theme of life as a performative act.
